{{EngvarB|date=April 2013}} {{Use dmy dates|date=April 2013}} {{Infobox football biography | name = Junior Stanislas | image = Junior Stanislas 2015.jpg | image_size = 175 | caption = Stanislas playing for [[AFC Bournemouth]] in 2015 | fullname = Felix Junior Stanislas<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.premierleague.com/news/612828 |title=Updated squads for 2017/18 Premier League confirmed |publisher=Premier League |date=2 February 2018 |accessdate=10 February 2018}}</ref> | birth_date = {{birth date and age|1989|11|26|df=y}}<ref name="Sky Sports Football Yearbook 2012–2013">{{cite book|editor1-first=Glenda|editor1-last=Rollin|editor2-first=Jack|editor2-last=Rollin|title=Sky Sports Football Yearbook 2012–2013|year=2012|publisher=[[Headline Publishing Group|Headline]]|location=London|isbn=978-0-7553-6356-8|page=444|edition=43rd}}</ref> | birth_place = [[Kidbrooke]], England | height = {{convert|1.83|m|order=flip}}<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.premierleague.com/players/3766/Junior-Stanislas/overview|title = Junior Stanislas|accessdate = 11 December 2017|publisher = Premier League}}</ref> | position = [[Midfielder#Winger|Winger]] | currentclub = [[A.F.C. Bournemouth|AFC Bournemouth]] | clubnumber = 19 | youthyears1 = 2000–2008 | youthclubs1 = [[West Ham United F.C.|West Ham United]] | years1 = 2008–2011 | clubs1 = [[West Ham United F.C.|West Ham United]] | caps1 = 42 | goals1 = 5 | years2 = 2008–2009 | clubs2 = → [[Southend United F.C.|Southend United]] (loan) | caps2 = 6 | goals2 = 1 | years3 = 2011–2014 | clubs3 = [[Burnley F.C.|Burnley]] | caps3 = 93 | goals3 = 7 | years4 = 2014– | clubs4 = [[A.F.C. Bournemouth|AFC Bournemouth]] | caps4 = 89 | goals4 = 17 | nationalyears1 = 2009 | nationalyears2 = 2009 | nationalteam1 = [[England national under-20 football team|England U20]] | nationalteam2 = [[England national under-21 football team|England U21]] | nationalcaps1 = 1 | nationalgoals1 = 0 | nationalcaps2 = 2 | nationalgoals2 = 0 | club-update = 15:08, 7 January 2019 (UTC) | nationalteam-update = }} '''Felix Junior Stanislas''' (born 26 November 1989), is an English professional [[Association football|footballer]] who plays as a [[Midfielder#Winger|winger]] for [[A.F.C. Bournemouth|AFC Bournemouth]].
He started his career in the youth team of [[West Ham United F.C.|West Ham United]] at the age of 10 in 2000. He signed a three-year academy contract in the summer of 2006, playing regularly for the under-18 side and reserves. In November 2008, he joined [[EFL League One|League One]] club [[Southend United F.C.|Southend United]] on a six-week loan. He made his first-team debut for West Ham in March 2009, at the age of 19. He signed a three-and-a-half-year contract in April 2009.
In August 2011, he joined [[EFL Championship|Championship]] club [[Burnley F.C.|Burnley]] on a three-year contract for an undisclosed fee. In June 2014 he signed for Bournemouth on a free transfer, helping them to the Championship title in his first season. In September 2018 he signed a contract extension with Bournemouth until 2021.<ref>{{cite web |last1=Perrett |first1=Neil |title=New deal for Stanislas |url=http://www.bournemouthecho.co.uk/sport/16695514.new-deal-for-stanislas/ |website=Daily Echo |accessdate=10 September 2018}}</ref>
==Club career== ===West Ham United=== Born in [[Kidbrooke]], London,<ref name="Player profile Junior Stanislas">{{cite web|url=http://www.whufc.com/page/PlayerProfilesDetail/0,,12562~43924,00.html |title=Player profile Junior Stanislas |publisher=West Ham United F.C. |accessdate=2010-04-28 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20090217040912/http://www.whufc.com/page/PlayerProfilesDetail/0%2C%2C12562~43924%2C00.html |archivedate=17 February 2009 |df= }}</ref> Stanislas first joined [[West Ham United F.C.|West Ham United]] as a schoolboy at the age of 10.<ref>[http://www.whufc.com/page/News/0,,12562~1606213,00.html England call for Stanislas] {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20090330212530/http://www.whufc.com/page/News/0%2C%2C12562~1606213%2C00.html |date=30 March 2009 }} West Ham United F.C.</ref> In May 2006, Stanislas signed a three-year academy scholarship. He made his [[Premier Academy League]] debut in a 3–2 defeat to [[Watford F.C.|Watford]] on 8 April 2006, at the age of 16.<ref name="Player profile Junior Stanislas"/> He became a regular for the Academy in the [[2006–07 FA Premier Academy League|2006–07]] season, appearing 26 times and scoring 9 goals as West Ham finished as runners-up to [[Arsenal F.C.|Arsenal]].<ref name="Player profile Junior Stanislas"/> He carried his goalscoring form into the [[2007–08 Premier Academy League|2007–08]] season, scoring 10 goals in 24 appearances. He made his [[Premier Reserve League]] debut on 29 August 2007, in a 2–1 defeat to [[Aston Villa F.C.|Aston Villa]]. His first goals came in the 8–0 rout over [[Derby County F.C.|Derby County]], as he netted a brace.<ref name="Player profile Junior Stanislas"/> He was part of the first-team squad that travelled to North America in the summer of 2008 for the pre-season tour.<ref name="WEST HAM YOUNGSTER SIGNS">{{cite web|url=http://www.southendunited.co.uk/page/NewsDetail/0,,10444~1468549,00.html |title=WEST HAM YOUNGSTER SIGNS |publisher=Southend United F.C. |accessdate=2008-11-27 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20090103003623/http://www.southendunited.co.uk/page/NewsDetail/0%2C%2C10444~1468549%2C00.html |archivedate= 3 January 2009 |df= }}</ref> He started the [[2008–09 Premier Reserve League|2008–09]] season in the reserves, scoring his first goal of the season on 21 October 2008, in a 1–0 home win over Arsenal.<ref name="Player profile Junior Stanislas"/>
====Loan to Southend United==== On 27 November 2008, Stanislas joined [[EFL League One|League One]] club [[Southend United F.C.|Southend United]] on loan for six weeks.<ref>{{cite news|title=Stanislas joins Southend on loan|url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport2/hi/football/teams/s/southend_utd/7753023.stm|publisher=[[BBC Sport]]|date=27 November 2008}}</ref> He made an immediate impact on his professional debut, scoring a brace, including a spectacular free kick, against [[Luton Town F.C.|Luton Town]] in the [[FA Cup]] [[2008-09 FA Cup#Second Round Proper|second round]] on 29 November.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport1/hi/football/fa_cup/7741969.stm |title=Southend 3–1 Luton |publisher=BBC Sport |date=29 November 2008 |accessdate=2010-04-28}}</ref> His league debut came on 6 December in a 3–0 defeat, away at [[Leicester City F.C.|Leicester City]].<ref>{{cite news|title=Leicester 3–0 Southend |url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport1/hi/football/eng_div_2/7752365.stm|publisher=[[BBC Sport]]|date=6 December 2008}}</ref> His first goal for Southend came on 26 December as he scored the only goal in a 1–0 win over [[Northampton Town F.C.|Northampton Town]], which brought to end a run of seven league games without victory.<ref>{{cite news|title=Southend 1–0 Northampton |url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport1/hi/football/eng_div_2/7787745.stm|publisher=[[BBC Sport]]|date=26 December 2008}}</ref> He was part of the side that earned a memorable 1–1 draw with [[Chelsea F.C.|Chelsea]] at [[Stamford Bridge (stadium)|Stamford Bridge]] in the FA Cup third round.<ref>{{cite news|title=Chelsea 1–1 Southend |url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport1/hi/football/fa_cup/7803244.stm|publisher=[[BBC Sport]]|date=3 January 2009}}</ref> However, Southend could not repeat their heroics at [[Roots Hall]] as the Shrimpers lost 4–1 in the replay. Stanislas returned to West Ham on 19 January 2009, after a 3–1 defeat to [[Stockport County F.C.|Stockport County]] at [[Edgeley Park]].<ref>{{cite news|title=STANISLAS RETURNS TO WEST HAM |url=http://www.southendunited.co.uk/page/NewsDetail/0,,10444~1525055,00.html |publisher=[[BBC Sport]] |date=19 January 2009 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20111005194653/http://www.southendunited.co.uk/page/NewsDetail/0%2C%2C10444~1525055%2C00.html |archivedate= 5 October 2011 |df= }}</ref> He made a total of nine appearances in all competitions, scoring three goals.
====Return to West Ham==== Stanislas made his West Ham and [[Premier League]] debut on 16 March 2009 against bottom of the table [[West Bromwich Albion F.C.|West Bromwich Albion]], replacing [[Savio Nsereko]] in the second half.<ref>[http://www.whufc.com/page/News/0,,12562~1593005,00.html West Brom stifle Hammers] {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20090318041228/http://www.whufc.com/page/News/0%2C%2C12562~1593005%2C00.html |date=18 March 2009 }} West Ham United F.C.</ref> He scored his first goal on his first start for the club, in a 2–0 home win against [[Sunderland A.F.C.|Sunderland]] on 4 April.<ref>[http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport1/hi/football/eng_prem/7972794.stm West Ham 2–0 Sunderland] BBC Sport</ref> On 9 April, he signed his first professional contract, a long-term four-and-a-half-year deal, lasting until the summer of 2013.<ref>{{cite news|title=Stanislas signs new Hammers deal|url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport2/hi/football/teams/w/west_ham_utd/7993539.stm|publisher=[[BBC Sport]]|date=10 April 2009}}</ref> He had an extended run in the first-team when first choice midfielders [[Valon Behrami]] and [[Jack Collison]] were both out injured. On 24 May, the last game of the season, Stanislas scored the winner in the 2–1 win over [[Middlesbrough F.C.|Middlesbrough]], which sealed Boro's relegation to the [[EFL Championship|Championship]].<ref>[http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport1/hi/football/teams/m/middlesbrough/8066448.stm Southgate braced for player exits] BBC Sport</ref> He made a total of 9 appearances for West Ham, scoring 2 goals in the [[2008–09 West Ham United F.C. season|2008–09]] season.
[[File:Junior Stanislas.jpg|thumb|left|upright|Stanislas with West Ham in January 2010]] Stanislas started the [[2009–10 West Ham United F.C. season|2009–10]] season as a first team regular featuring in the first 5 games, including a 2–0 away win over [[Wolverhampton Wanderers F.C.|Wolverhampton Wanderers]]. He also scored a brace in West Ham's 3–1 [[EFL Cup|League Cup]] [[2009–10 Football League Cup|second round]] victory over arch-rivals [[Millwall F.C.|Millwall]] in August 2009. The first goal came three minutes from time before scoring a [[Penalty kick (association football)|penalty kick]] winner in [[extra time]]. However, the game was marred by the [[2009 Upton Park riot]] which included pitch invasions after both of Stanislas' goals.<ref>{{cite news |url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport1/hi/football/league_cup/8205836.stm|title=West Ham 3–1 Millwall|publisher=BBC Sport|date=25 August 2009 |accessdate=13 October 2009}}</ref> His second goal of the season came on 4 October 2009, when he came off the bench to score a last minute equaliser in a 2–2 draw with [[Fulham F.C.|Fulham]].<ref name="Player profile Junior Stanislas"/> His final goal of the season was on 28 November 2009, scoring the second goal in a 5–3 win over [[Burnley F.C.|Burnley]].<ref name="Player profile Junior Stanislas"/> He remained a first-team player until the end of the season featuring heavily in the run-in as West Ham secured their Premier League safety. Stanislas made a total of 28 appearances in all competitions, scoring 4 goals in the [[2009–10 West Ham United F.C. season|2009–10]] season.<ref name="Player profile Junior Stanislas"/>
In the summer of 2010, [[Gianfranco Zola]] was replaced by [[Avram Grant]] as manager and Stanislas found himself down the pecking order at [[Boleyn Ground|Upton Park]]. His first appearance of the season was on 24 August 2010, in a 1–0 win over [[Oxford United F.C.|Oxford United]] in the League Cup.<ref name="Player profile Junior Stanislas"/> He had a prolonged spell in the first team during November and December, making 5 appearances. On 18 December 2010, he scored the equalising goal against [[Blackburn Rovers F.C.|Blackburn Rovers]] in a 1–1 draw at [[Ewood Park]], after coming on as a substitute for [[Pablo Barrera]] in the second half.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.rs.goal.com/en-us/match/47951/blackburn-vs-west-ham/report# |title=Blackburn vs West Ham Report |publisher=Goal.com |date=18 December 2010 |accessdate=2012-06-07}}</ref> His final game of the season was on 1 January 2011, in a 2–0 win over [[Wolverhampton Wanderers F.C.|Wolverhampton Wanderers]]. In January 2011, he was ruled out until the end of the season after undergoing hernia surgery.<ref name="Player profile Junior Stanislas"/> After four months out, he made his comeback for the reserves on 11 May, playing 30 minutes in a 3–2 defeat to [[Tottenham Hotspur F.C.|Tottenham Hotspur]].<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.whufc.com/articles/20110511/stanislas-returns-for-reserves_2236884_2358060|title=Stanislas returns for reserves|publisher=West Ham United F.C.|date=11 May 2011|accessdate=2012-06-07|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20110827130855/http://www.whufc.com/articles/20110511/stanislas-returns-for-reserves_2236884_2358060|archivedate=27 August 2011|df=dmy-all}}</ref> He made a total of 8 appearances in all competitions, scoring 1 goal in the [[2010–11 West Ham United F.C. season|2010–11]] season as West Ham were relegated to the Championship.<ref name="Player profile Junior Stanislas"/>
The summer again brought a change of manager with [[Sam Allardyce]] replacing the departed Avram Grant. His first game of the season was in the league game against [[Doncaster Rovers F.C.|Doncaster Rovers]] on 13 August 2011, coming on as a late substitute for [[Herita Ilunga]] in a 1–0 victory.<ref>{{cite news|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/14429582 |title=Doncaster 0–1 West Ham |publisher=BBC sport |date=13 August 2011 |accessdate=2012-06-07}}</ref> On 24 August 2011, he scored his first goal of the season in what proved to be his final appearance for the Hammers, in their 2–1 League Cup defeat to [[Aldershot Town F.C.|Aldershot Town]].<ref>{{cite news |url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport1/hi/football/14569566.stm|title=West Ham 1–2 Aldershot|publisher=BBC Sport|date=24 August 2011|accessdate=27 August 2011}}</ref>
===Burnley=== On 31 August 2011, Stanislas joined fellow Championship club [[Burnley F.C.|Burnley]] on a three-year contract for an undisclosed fee, becoming the club's seventh summer signing.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.burnleyfootballclub.com/page/LatestHeadlines/0,,10413~2437351,00.html |title=Junior jets in! |publisher=Burnley F.C. |date=31 August 2011 |accessdate=31 August 2011 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20120930013224/http://www.burnleyfootballclub.com/page/LatestHeadlines/0%2C%2C10413~2437351%2C00.html |archivedate=30 September 2012 |df= }}</ref> He stated the main reason for leaving West Ham was due to lack of game time.<ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.lancashiretelegraph.co.uk/sport/football/9227369.Stanislas_eager_to_get_started_at_Burnley/|title=Stanislas eager to get started at Burnley|publisher=Lancashire Evening Telegraph|date=1 September 2011|accessdate=7 June 2012}}</ref> His debut for the Clarets came on 10 September, in a 2–0 defeat to [[Middlesbrough F.C.|Middlesbrough]] at [[Turf Moor]], coming on as a second-half substitute for [[Keith Treacy]].<ref>{{cite news |url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport1/hi/football/eng_div_1/14773085.stm|title=Burnley 0 – 2 Middlesbrough |publisher=BBC Sport|date=10 September 2011|accessdate=7 June 2012}}</ref> His first start for the club came on 24 September, in a 1–1 draw with [[Southampton F.C.|Southampton]].<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/14957886|title=Burnley 1 – 1 Southampton |publisher=BBC Sport|date=24 September 2011|accessdate=7 June 2012}}</ref> He provided two assists 3 days later for [[Jay Rodriguez]] in the 5–1 drubbing of [[Nottingham Forest F.C.|Nottingham Forest]].<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/14982428|title=Burnley 5 – 1 Nott'm Forest |publisher=BBC Sport|date=27 September 2011|accessdate=7 June 2012}}</ref> On 3 December, he returned to his old club as Burnley secured a 2–1 victory, with Stanislas providing the assist for the [[Chris McCann]] equaliser.<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/15901825|title=West Ham 1 – 2 Burnley |publisher=BBC Sport|date=3 December 2011|accessdate=7 June 2012}}</ref> In January 2012, he sustained a hamstring injury against Middlesbrough which kept him sidelined for two months.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.burnleyfootballclub.com/page/LatestHeadlines/0,,10413~2581416,00.html |title=Paterson and Stanislas Injury Updates |publisher=Burnley F.C. |date=30 January 2012 |accessdate=7 June 2012 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20120122044918/http://www.burnleyfootballclub.com/page/LatestHeadlines/0%2C%2C10413~2581416%2C00.html |archivedate=22 January 2012 |df= }}</ref> His return came on 10 March 2012, in a 1–1 home draw with [[Crystal Palace F.C.|Crystal Palace]], coming on in the final few minutes for [[Martin Paterson]]. His final appearance of the season was in the 1–1 draw with [[Bristol City F.C.|Bristol City]] as Burnley finished mid-table.<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/17795497|title=Burnley 1–1 Bristol City |publisher=BBC Sport|date=28 April 2012|accessdate=7 June 2012}}</ref> Stanislas made a total of 32 appearances in his debut season for Burnley, scoring no goals. In his second season at Turf Moor, Stanislas was again a regular first-teamer; appearing in all but 11 league matches and scoring 5 goals.
===AFC Bournemouth=== On 26 June 2014, Stanislas joined [[A.F.C. Bournemouth|AFC Bournemouth]]. He had been offered a new contract at Turf Moor, but this was turned down in favour of reuniting with former manager [[Eddie Howe]].<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/28037282|title=Junior Stanislas: Bournemouth sign Burnley winger |publisher=BBC Sport|date=26 June 2014|accessdate=28 June 2014}}</ref>
He made his debut for the Cherries on 9 August, coming on in added time for [[Marc Pugh]] as they began [[2014–15 Football League Championship|the season]] with a 4–0 win at [[Huddersfield Town]].<ref>{{cite news|title=Huddersfield 0–4 Bournemouth|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/28646430|accessdate=13 December 2015|publisher=BBC Sport|date=9 August 2014}}</ref> A week later, six minutes after coming off the bench, he finished [[Ryan Fraser]]'s cross for the only goal at [[Dean Court]] against [[Brentford F.C.|Brentford]];<ref>{{cite news|title=Bournemouth 1–0 Brentford|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/28716512|accessdate=13 December 2015|publisher=BBC Sport|date=16 August 2014}}</ref> this was his only goal in 13 appearances as Bournemouth won the title, earning their first promotion to the Premier League. On 3 January 2015, in the third round of the FA Cup, Stanislas put Bournemouth in the lead as they came from behind to win 5–1 at [[Rotherham United]].<ref>{{cite news|title=Rotherham 1–5 Bournemouth|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/30608632|accessdate=13 December 2015|publisher=BBC Sport|date=3 January 2015}}</ref>
On 25 August 2015, Stanislas scored in each half as Bournemouth defeated [[Hartlepool United]] 4–0 at the [[Victoria Ground]] in the second round of the League Cup.<ref>{{cite news|title=Hartlepool 0–4 Bournemouth|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/33969810|accessdate=13 December 2015|publisher=BBC Sport|date=25 August 2015}}</ref> His first Premier League goals for the club came on 28 November, two late strikes to seal a 3–3 home draw against [[Everton F.C.|Everton]].<ref>{{cite news|last1=Gheerbrant|first1=James|title=Bournemouth 3–3 Everton|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/34887539|accessdate=13 December 2015|publisher=BBC Sport|date=28 November 2015}}</ref> Two weeks later, Stanislas opened the scoring in the second minute of an eventual 2–1 win over [[Manchester United]], [[Olympic goal|netting directly from a corner kick]].<ref>{{cite news|last1=Henson|first1=Mike|title=Bournemouth 2–1 Man Utd|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/35014111|accessdate=13 December 2015|publisher=BBC Sport|date=12 December 2015}}</ref>
==International career== Stanislas has been capped for England at under-19, under-20 and under-21 level.<ref>{{cite news|author=Duncan |url=http://londonist.com/2009/04/football_england_2_italy_0_under_20.php |title=Football: England 2 Italy 0 (Under 20 International Friendly) |publisher=Londonist.com |date=1 April 2009 |accessdate=2010-04-28}}</ref> He was called up to the [[England national under-19 football team|England U19]] squad for the first time in November 2007, along with West Ham teammate, [[James Tomkins (footballer)|James Tomkins]], for a friendly against [[Germany national under-19 football team|Germany]].<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.whufc.com/articles/20071114/england-call-stanislas-and-tomkins_2236884_1166558|title=England call Stanislas and Tomkins|publisher=West Ham United F.C.|date=14 November 2007|accessdate=2012-06-07|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160807061528/http://www.whufc.com/articles/20071114/england-call-stanislas-and-tomkins_2236884_1166558|archivedate=7 August 2016|df=dmy-all}}</ref> His second call-up came in February 2008, for a friendly against [[Croatia national under-19 football team|Croatia]] at the [[County Ground, Swindon]].<ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.whufc.com/articles/20080205/stanislas-and-sears-get-england-call_2236884_1231578|archive-url=https://archive.is/20130209071318/http://www.whufc.com/articles/20080205/stanislas-and-sears-get-england-call_2236884_1231578|dead-url=yes|archive-date=9 February 2013| title=Stanislas and Sears get England call |publisher=West Ham United F.C. |date=5 February 2008 |accessdate=2012-06-07}}</ref> On 31 March 2009, he made his debut for the [[England national under-20 football team|England U20]]'s in a 2–0 win over [[Italy national under-20 football team|Italy]], coming on as a substitute for [[Scott Sinclair]] in a friendly at [[Loftus Road]].<ref>{{cite news|title=Stanislas England profile|url=http://www.thefa.com/England/All-Teams/Players/S/Junior-Stanislas|publisher=[[The Football Association]]}}</ref> He received his first call-up to the [[England national under-21 football team|England U21]] side for a friendly against the [[Netherlands national under-21 football team|Netherlands]] on 11 August 2009 and made his debut starting in the 0–0 draw.<ref>{{cite news|title=New campaign and new faces for Pearce |url=http://thefa.com/England/MensUnder-21Team/NewsAndFeatures/2009/SquadNamed_HollandGroningen.aspx |archive-url=https://archive.is/20120715042304/http://thefa.com/England/MensUnder-21Team/NewsAndFeatures/2009/SquadNamed_HollandGroningen.aspx |dead-url=yes |archive-date=15 July 2012 |publisher=[[The Football Association]] |date=5 August 2009 }}</ref> In September 2009, [[Stuart Pearce]] then named him in the squad for the [[2011 UEFA European Under-21 Football Championship qualification Group 9|2011 European Championship qualifiers]] against [[Macedonia national under-21 football team|Macedonia]] and [[Greece national under-21 football team|Greece]]. His final appearance for the team on 4 September, in the 2–1 victory over Macedonia, before being an unused substitute in the 1–1 draw with Greece four days later.<ref>{{cite news|title=Macedonia Under-21 1 England Under-21 2: match report|url=https://www.telegraph.co.uk/sport/football/teams/england/6139929/Macedonia-Under-21-1-England-Under-21-2-match-report.html|publisher=The Telegraph|date=4 September 2009}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|title=Greece U21 1–1 England U21 |url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport1/hi/football/internationals/8245183.stm|publisher=BBS Sport|date=8 September 2009}}</ref>
He is eligible to play for the [[Saint Lucia national football team|Saint Lucia national team]] through his father, Felix. He said "I'm half St Lucian so I could play internationals for them if I wanted... but I don't."<ref>FourFourTwo Magazine. November 2009 edition. p. 34</ref>
==Personal life== Stanislas went to Catholic school as a child and [[Stationers' Crown Woods Academy|Crown Woods School]] in Eltham in his teens.<ref>{{Cite web | title = Premier League Star, Junior Stanislas, Returns To SCWA | publisher = Stationers' Crown Woods Academy | date = 9 February 2018 | accessdate = 6 April 2018 | url = http://scwa.org.uk/2018/02/09/premier-league-star-junior-stanislas-returns-to-scwa/}}</ref> He remains a devout [[Christianity|Christian]] today. His favourite stadium to play at is [[Old Trafford]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://xtheline.co.uk/bournemouth-star-reveals-love-jesus/|work=Cross The Line|title=AFC Bournemouth star, Junior Stanislas: "My faith means a lot to me"|author=Ollie Baines|date=3 April 2016|accessdate=28 September 2016}}</ref>
==Career statistics== {{updated|match played 1 October 2018}}

!colspan="2"|[[EFL Cup|League Cup]] !colspan="2"|Other !colspan="2"|Total |- !Division||Apps||Goals||Apps||Goals||Apps||Goals||Apps||Goals||Apps||Goals |- | rowspan="5"|[[West Ham United F.C.|West Ham United]] |[[2008–09 West Ham United F.C. season|2008–09]]<ref name="West Ham 2008/2009 player appearances">{{Soccerbase season|49981|2008| accessdate = 14 February 2018}}</ref> |[[Premier League]]
